author: XxPhoenixHarpyexX2

text:
I can understand why people hate this song in the game: there's not really a whole lot to it. It's maybe a 1:15 loop or so, which is great in a casual iphone game, perhaps, but not in a long dungeon where you're being forced to listen to the same short loop over and over again. On top of that, I think it also has to do with the fact that the main melody is so high pitched.

I personally like this song a lot in small doses because of its eerie nature. But again, I understand why people hate it.
author: Diffuse Moose

text: It took me a couple of days to beat the dungeon, but this song got stuck in my mind for a long time. It's a good theme, but, whenever I hear it, I remember the headache....

author: fishluv [pop'n music]

text: I thought this dungeon was a pain the ass, but in all I liked it... It's kind of surreal, seeing such a dungeon but knowing that it's home to the Oocca, you know? When I hear this song I'm suddenly taken back to the big main chamber with all the little Oocca sitting around, where you can pick them up and glide along with them as if they were Cucco or something.... It's actually just so neat.... The part where we were really high in the air makes me dizzy thinking about it though. :P

text: Sidious66, I sort of half way agree with you. I LOVED this track when I first heard it because it was creepy, yet relaxing. But...I think it was a bad idea for the composer to make the song's loop so short considering you had to hear the song throughout an entire level. Still, I do enjoy hearing this one from time to time.

author: Nation of Masturbation

text:
The dual hookshot was one of the few items that was actually neccessary for future levels beyond the temple you find it in. 

I remember I got stuck at the last temple because of the torch you had to put out with the boomerang, but since I hadn't used it since the first temple it took me forever to figure out.

I think I onlt died twice in the game. The first time I drowned on perpose to see what happens and the second was against Zelda because reflecting fire balls with the wii control suck
author: eishikibahamut

text:
I LOVED the spinner.  It's nice to see the Zelda team keep coming up with neat items.  The first half of that boss fight was pure gold.

The sky temple ended up being kinda annoying.  Although I personally find the dual hookshot's to be my favorite item(s) in the zelda game series.  It has this feel to it.

Zero, I find it impossible to believe that you can't find ONE game less enjoyable than TP.  You mean you would rather play Superman 64 or Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde than Zelda TP?
author: Th3Skull3r

text:
My least favorites were Temple of Time in TP which was really freaking linear and the Sky Temple. Sure dual grappling hooks are cool, but the build up for the Sky Temple was so overwhelming for me that there was no way it would meet my expectations. It didn't even have Ritos! I was so pumped to see them with the new graphics, but Instead I was greated to retarded chickens WTH.

The Spinner in the Desert level was awesome though. to bad it is never used after except for a few moments at the end
author: eishikibahamut

text: The original zelda is one of my favorites. I have to agree with Zero on this. TP shouldn't even be compared to other Zelda games. If you look at it as a stand alone adventure game it's pretty good I suppose.
author: eishikibahamut

text: Twilight Princess isn't my favorite Zelda game either.  I might have liked it more if I played it before I played Okami and Alundra but I played it after.  Those two games are on equal footing with and in some respects even surpass the best games of the Zelda series.  I actually think most of my personal disappointment came from that reason.
author: assgoblin2damax

text:
MM is actually my favorite tied with the original. 

I have no Idea why you liked TP or why anyone does. It's the single most disappointing game I've ever played. I'd rather play pretty much any game over it honestly.
author: ZeroOmnislash

text: ehh.... TP was not the worst in the series... its MUCH better than the NES original and the game boy ones.  TP is a great game, but it just doesn't match OoT.  I personally liked it better than MM, but that doesn't mean it's a better game.

agreed you can't even compare MMs Levels to TPs. IMO TP was the worse in the series*

text: TP's dungeons were lacking when compared to OoT :(  But the music was outstanding like always.  This is certainly a game to remember
author: Th3Skull3r

text:
well, it wasn't THAT bad. The whole "finding something at the beginning of a dungeon but not using it till the very end" is used quite a bit in Zelda.
A worse dungeon in my opinion is the Temple of Time, for the exact opposite reason. It was so freakin easy. Took me 25-30 minutes to beat.
But anyway, this song is great, provides a perfect ambience for the level.
